member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.JoinMode
member.summary: Defines possible values for OpJoinRoom and OpJoinOrCreate. It tells the server if the room can be only be joined normally, created implicitly or found on a web-service for Turnbased games.
member.remarks: These values are not directly used by a game but implicitly set.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.JoinMode.Default
member.summary: Regular join. The room must exist.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.JoinMode.CreateIfNotExists
member.summary: Join or create the room if it's not existing. Used for OpJoinOrCreate for example.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.JoinMode.JoinOrRejoin
member.summary: The room might be out of memory and should be loaded (if possible) from a Turnbased web-service.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.JoinMode.RejoinOnly
member.summary: Only re-join will be allowed. If the user is not yet in the room, this will fail.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.MatchmakingMode
member.summary: Options for matchmaking rules for OpJoinRandom.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.MatchmakingMode.FillRoom
member.summary: Fills up rooms (oldest first) to get players together as fast as possible. Default.
member.remarks: Makes most sense with MaxPlayers > 0 and games that can only start with more players.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.MatchmakingMode.SerialMatching
member.summary: Distributes players across available rooms sequentially but takes filter into account. Without filter, rooms get players evenly distributed.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.MatchmakingMode.RandomMatching
member.summary: Joins a (fully) random room. Expected properties must match but aside from this, any available room might be selected.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.ReceiverGroup
member.summary: Lite - OpRaiseEvent lets you chose which actors in the room should receive events. By default, events are sent to "Others" but you can overrule this.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.ReceiverGroup.Others
member.summary: Default value (not sent). Anyone else gets my event.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.ReceiverGroup.All
member.summary: Everyone in the current room (including this peer) will get this event.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.ReceiverGroup.MasterClient
member.summary: The server sends this event only to the actor with the lowest actorNumber.
member.remarks: The "master client" does not have special rights but is the one who is in this room the longest time.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching
member.summary: Lite - OpRaiseEvent allows you to cache events and automatically send them to joining players in a room. Events are cached per event code and player: Event 100 (example!) can be stored once per player. Cached events can be modified, replaced and removed.
member.remarks: Caching works only combination with ReceiverGroup options Others and All.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.DoNotCache
member.summary: Default value (not sent).

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.MergeCache
member.summary: Will merge this event's keys with those already cached.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.ReplaceCache
member.summary: Replaces the event cache for this eventCode with this event's content.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.RemoveCache
member.summary: Removes this event (by eventCode) from the cache.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.AddToRoomCache
member.summary: Adds an event to the room's cache

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.AddToRoomCacheGlobal
member.summary: Adds this event to the cache for actor 0 (becoming a "globally owned" event in the cache).

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.RemoveFromRoomCache
member.summary: Remove fitting event from the room's cache.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.RemoveFromRoomCacheForActorsLeft
member.summary: Removes events of players who already left the room (cleaning up).

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.SliceIncreaseIndex
member.summary: Increase the index of the sliced cache.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.SliceSetIndex
member.summary: Set the index of the sliced cache. You must set RaiseEventOptions.CacheSliceIndex for this.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.SlicePurgeIndex
member.summary: Purge cache slice with index. Exactly one slice is removed from cache. You must set RaiseEventOptions.CacheSliceIndex for this.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.EventCaching.SlicePurgeUpToIndex
member.summary: Purge cache slices with specified index and anything lower than that. You must set RaiseEventOptions.CacheSliceIndex for this.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.PropertyTypeFlag
member.summary: Flags for "types of properties", being used as filter in OpGetProperties.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.PropertyTypeFlag.None
member.summary: (0x00) Flag type for no property type.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.PropertyTypeFlag.Game
member.summary: (0x01) Flag type for game-attached properties.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.PropertyTypeFlag.Actor
member.summary: (0x02) Flag type for actor related propeties.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.PropertyTypeFlag.GameAndActor
member.summary: (0x01) Flag type for game AND actor properties. Equal to 'Game'

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions
member.summary: Wraps up common room properties needed when you create rooms. Read the individual entries for more details.
member.remarks: This directly maps to the fields in the Room class.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.IsVisible
member.summary: Defines if this room is listed in the lobby. If not, it also is not joined randomly.
member.remarks:
A room that is not visible will be excluded from the room lists that are sent to the clients in lobbies. An invisible room can be joined by name but is excluded from random matchmaking.
Use this to "hide" a room and simulate "private rooms". Players can exchange a roomname and create it invisble to avoid anyone else joining it.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.IsOpen
member.summary: Defines if this room can be joined at all.
member.remarks: If a room is closed, no player can join this. As example this makes sense when 3 of 4 possible players start their gameplay early and don't want anyone to join during the game. The room can still be listed in the lobby (set isVisible to control lobby-visibility).

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.MaxPlayers
member.summary: Max number of players that can be in the room at any time. 0 means "no limit".

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.PlayerTtl
member.summary: Time To Live (TTL) for an 'actor' in a room. If a client disconnects, this actor is inactive first and removed after this timeout. In milliseconds.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.EmptyRoomTtl
member.summary: Time To Live (TTL) for a room when the last player leaves. Keeps room in memory for case a player re-joins soon. In milliseconds.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.CleanupCacheOnLeave
member.summary: Removes a user's events and properties from the room when a user leaves.
member.remarks: This makes sense when in rooms where players can't place items in the room and just vanish entirely. When you disable this, the event history can become too long to load if the room stays in use indefinitely. Default: true. Cleans up the cache and props of leaving users.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.CustomRoomProperties
member.summary: The room's custom properties to set. Use string keys!
member.remarks: Custom room properties are any key-values you need to define the game's setup. The shorter your keys are, the better. Example: Map, Mode (could be "m" when used with "Map"), TileSet (could be "t").

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.CustomRoomPropertiesForLobby
member.summary: Defines the custom room properties that get listed in the lobby.
member.remarks:
Name the custom room properties that should be available to clients that are in a lobby. Use with care. Unless a custom property is essential for matchmaking or user info, it should not be sent to the lobby, which causes traffic and delays for clients in the lobby.
Default: No custom properties are sent to the lobby.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.Plugins
member.summary: Informs the server of the expected plugin setup.
member.remarks: The operation will fail in case of a plugin missmatch returning error code PluginMismatch 32757(0x7FFF - 10). Setting string[]{} means the client expects no plugin to be setup. Note: for backwards compatibility null omits any check.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.SuppressRoomEvents
member.summary: Tells the server to skip room events for joining and leaving players.
member.remarks: Using this makes the client unaware of the other players in a room. That can save some traffic if you have some server logic that updates players but it can also limit the client's usability.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.SuppressPlayerInfo
member.summary: Disables events join and leave from the server as well as property broadcasts in a room (to minimize traffic)

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.PublishUserId
member.summary: Defines if the UserIds of players get "published" in the room. Useful for FindFriends, if players want to play another game together.
member.remarks: When you set this to true, Photon will publish the UserIds of the players in that room. In that case, you can use PhotonPlayer.userId, to access any player's userID. This is useful for FindFriends and to set "expected users" to reserve slots in a room.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.DeleteNullProperties
member.summary: Optionally, properties get deleted, when null gets assigned as value. Defaults to off / false.
member.remarks:
When Op SetProperties is setting a key's value to null, the server and clients should remove the key/value from the Custom Properties. By default, the server keeps the keys (and null values) and sends them to joining players.
Important: Only when SetProperties does a "broadcast", the change (key, value = null) is sent to clients to update accordingly. This applies to Custom Properties for rooms and actors/players.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomOptions.BroadcastPropsChangeToAll
member.summary: By default, property changes are sent back to the client that's setting them to avoid de-sync when properties are set concurrently.
member.remarks:
This option is enables by default to fix this scenario:
1) On server, room property ABC is set to value FOO, which triggers notifications to all the clients telling them that the property changed. 2) While that notification is in flight, a client sets the ABC property to value BAR. 3) Client receives notification from the server and changes its local copy of ABC to FOO. 4) Server receives the set operation and changes the official value of ABC to BAR, but never notifies the client that sent the set operation that the value is now BAR.
Without this option, the client that set the value to BAR never hears from the server that the official copy has been updated to BAR, and thus gets stuck with a value of FOO.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RaiseEventOptions
member.summary: Aggregates several less-often used options for operation RaiseEvent. See field descriptions for usage details.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RaiseEventOptions.Default
member.summary: Default options: CachingOption: DoNotCache, InterestGroup: 0, targetActors: null, receivers: Others, sequenceChannel: 0.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RaiseEventOptions.CachingOption
member.summary: Defines if the server should simply send the event, put it in the cache or remove events that are like this one.
member.remarks: When using option: SliceSetIndex, SlicePurgeIndex or SlicePurgeUpToIndex, set a CacheSliceIndex. All other options except SequenceChannel get ignored.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RaiseEventOptions.InterestGroup
member.summary: The number of the Interest Group to send this to. 0 goes to all users but to get 1 and up, clients must subscribe to the group first.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RaiseEventOptions.TargetActors
member.summary: A list of Player.ActorNumbers to send this event to. You can implement events that just go to specific users this way.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RaiseEventOptions.Receivers
member.summary: Sends the event to All, MasterClient or Others (default). Be careful with MasterClient, as the client might disconnect before it got the event and it gets lost.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RaiseEventOptions.SequenceChannel
member.summary: Events are ordered per "channel". If you have events that are independent of others, they can go into another sequence or channel.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RaiseEventOptions.Flags
member.summary: Optional flags to be used in Photon client SDKs with Op RaiseEvent and Op SetProperties.
member.remarks: Introduced mainly for webhooks 1.2 to control behavior of forwarded HTTP requests.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.LobbyType
member.summary: Types of lobbies define their behaviour and capabilities. Check each value for details.
member.remarks: Values of this enum must be matched by the server.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.LobbyType.Default
member.summary: Standard type and behaviour: While joined to this lobby clients get room-lists and JoinRandomRoom can use a simple filter to match properties (perfectly).

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.LobbyType.SqlLobby
member.summary: This lobby type lists rooms like Default but JoinRandom has a parameter for SQL-like "where" clauses for filtering. This allows bigger, less, or and and combinations.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.LobbyType.AsyncRandomLobby
member.summary: This lobby does not send lists of games. It is only used for OpJoinRandomRoom. It keeps rooms available for a while when there are only inactive users left.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobby
member.summary: Refers to a specific lobby on the server.
member.remarks:
Name and Type combined are the unique identifier for a lobby.
The server will create lobbies "on demand", so no registration or setup is required.
An empty or null Name always points to the "default lobby" as special case.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobby.Name
member.summary: Name of the lobby. Default: null, pointing to the "default lobby".
member.remarks: If Name is null or empty, a TypedLobby will point to the "default lobby". This ignores the Type value and always acts as .

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobby.Type
member.summary: Type (and behaviour) of the lobby.
member.remarks: An empty or null Name always points to the "default lobby" as special case.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobby.Default
member.summary: A reference to the default lobby which is the unique lobby that uses null as name and is of type .
member.remarks:
There is only a single lobby with an empty name on the server. It is always of type .
On the other hand, this is a shortcut and reusable reference to the default lobby.
Do not change Name or Type.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobby.IsDefault
member.summary: Returns whether or not this instance points to the "default lobby" ().
member.remarks: This comes up to checking if the Name is null or empty. is not the same thing as the "default lobby" ().

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobby.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a TypedLobby instance. Unless Name is changed, this points to the "default lobby" ().

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobby.#ctor(System.String,Fusion.Photon.Realtime.LobbyType)
member.summary: Sets Name and Type of the new instance. Make sure name is not empty or null, as that always points to the "default lobby" ().
member.param: Some string to identify a lobby.
The type of a lobby defines it's capabilities and behaviour.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobbyInfo
member.summary: Info for a lobby on the server. Used when is true.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobbyInfo.PlayerCount
member.summary: Count of players that currently joined this lobby.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.TypedLobbyInfo.RoomCount
member.summary: Count of rooms currently associated with this lobby.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthModeOption
member.summary: Options for authentication modes. From "classic" auth on each server to AuthOnce (on NameServer).

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType
member.summary: Options for optional "Custom Authentication" services used with Photon. Used by OpAuthenticate after connecting to Photon.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.Custom
member.summary: Use a custom authentication service. Currently the only implemented option.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.Steam
member.summary: Authenticates users by their Steam Account. Set Steam's ticket as "ticket" via AddAuthParameter().

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.Facebook
member.summary: Authenticates users by their Facebook Account. Set Facebooks's tocken as "token" via AddAuthParameter().

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.Oculus
member.summary: Authenticates users by their Oculus Account and token. Set Oculus' userid as "userid" and nonce as "nonce" via AddAuthParameter().

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.PlayStation4
member.summary: Authenticates users by their PSN Account and token on PS4. Set token as "token", env as "env" and userName as "userName" via AddAuthParameter().

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.Xbox
member.summary: Authenticates users by their Xbox Account. Pass the XSTS token via SetAuthPostData().

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.Viveport
member.summary: Authenticates users by their HTC Viveport Account. Set userToken as "userToken" via AddAuthParameter().

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.NintendoSwitch
member.summary: Authenticates users by their NSA ID. Set token as "token" and appversion as "appversion" via AddAuthParameter(). The appversion is optional.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.PlayStation5
member.summary: Authenticates users by their PSN Account and token on PS5. Set token as "token", env as "env" and userName as "userName" via AddAuthParameter().

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.Epic
member.summary: Authenticates users with Epic Online Services (EOS). Set token as "token" and ownershipToken as "ownershipToken" via AddAuthParameter(). The ownershipToken is optional.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.FacebookGaming
member.summary: Authenticates users with Facebook Gaming api. Set token as "token" via AddAuthParameter().

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.CustomAuthenticationType.None
member.summary: Disables custom authentication. Same as not providing any AuthenticationValues for connect (more precisely for: OpAuthenticate).

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues
member.summary: Container for user authentication in Photon. Set AuthValues before you connect - all else is handled.
member.remarks:
On Photon, user authentication is optional but can be useful in many cases. If you want to FindFriends, a unique ID per user is very practical.
There are basically three options for user authentication: None at all, the client sets some UserId or you can use some account web-service to authenticate a user (and set the UserId server-side).
Custom Authentication lets you verify end-users by some kind of login or token. It sends those values to Photon which will verify them before granting access or disconnecting the client.
The AuthValues are sent in OpAuthenticate when you connect, so they must be set before you connect. If the AuthValues.UserId is null or empty when it's sent to the server, then the Photon Server assigns a UserId!
The Photon Cloud Dashboard will let you enable this feature and set important server values for it. https://dashboard.photonengine.com

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.authType
member.summary: See AuthType.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.AuthType
member.summary: The type of authentication provider that should be used. Defaults to None (no auth whatsoever).
member.remarks: Several auth providers are available and CustomAuthenticationType.Custom can be used if you build your own service.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.AuthGetParameters
member.summary: This string must contain any (http get) parameters expected by the used authentication service. By default, username and token.
member.remarks: Maps to operation parameter 216. Standard http get parameters are used here and passed on to the service that's defined in the server (Photon Cloud Dashboard).

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.AuthPostData
member.summary: Data to be passed-on to the auth service via POST. Default: null (not sent). Either string or byte[] (see setters).
member.remarks: Maps to operation parameter 214.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.Token
member.summary: Internal Photon token. After initial authentication, Photon provides a token for this client, subsequently used as (cached) validation.
member.remarks: Any token for custom authentication should be set via SetAuthPostData or AddAuthParameter.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.UserId
member.summary: The UserId should be a unique identifier per user. This is for finding friends, etc..
member.remarks: See remarks of AuthValues for info about how this is set and used.

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.#ctor
member.summary: Creates empty auth values without any info.

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates minimal info about the user. If this is authenticated or not, depends on the set AuthType.
member.param: Some UserId to set in Photon.

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.SetAuthPostData(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the data to be passed-on to the auth service via POST.
member.remarks: AuthPostData is just one value. Each SetAuthPostData replaces any previous value. It can be either a string, a byte[] or a dictionary.
member.param: String data to be used in the body of the POST request. Null or empty string will set AuthPostData to null.

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.SetAuthPostData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sets the data to be passed-on to the auth service via POST.
member.remarks: AuthPostData is just one value. Each SetAuthPostData replaces any previous value. It can be either a string, a byte[] or a dictionary.
member.param: Binary token / auth-data to pass on.

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.AuthenticationValues.SetAuthPostData(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Sets data to be passed-on to the auth service as Json (Content-Type: "application/json") via Post.

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.Player.SetCustomProperties(ExitGames.Client.Photon.Hashtable,ExitGames.Client.Photon.Hashtable,Fusion.Photon.Realtime.WebFlags)
member.summary: Updates and synchronizes this Player's Custom Properties. Optionally, expectedProperties can be provided as condition.
member.remarks:
Custom Properties are a set of string keys and arbitrary values which is synchronized for the players in a Room. They are available when the client enters the room, as they are in the response of OpJoin and OpCreate.
Custom Properties either relate to the (current) Room or a Player (in that Room).
Both classes locally cache the current key/values and make them available as property: CustomProperties. This is provided only to read them. You must use the method SetCustomProperties to set/modify them.
Any client can set any Custom Properties anytime (when in a room). It's up to the game logic to organize how they are best used.
You should call SetCustomProperties only with key/values that are new or changed. This reduces traffic and performance.
Unless you define some expectedProperties, setting key/values is always permitted. In this case, the property-setting client will not receive the new values from the server but instead update its local cache in SetCustomProperties.
If you define expectedProperties, the server will skip updates if the server property-cache does not contain all expectedProperties with the same values. In this case, the property-setting client will get an update from the server and update it's cached key/values at about the same time as everyone else.
The benefit of using expectedProperties can be only one client successfully sets a key from one known value to another. As example: Store who owns an item in a Custom Property "ownedBy". It's 0 initally. When multiple players reach the item, they all attempt to change "ownedBy" from 0 to their actorNumber. If you use expectedProperties {"ownedBy", 0} as condition, the first player to take the item will have it (and the others fail to set the ownership).
Properties get saved with the game state for Turnbased games (which use IsPersistent = true).
member.param: Hashtable of Custom Properties to be set.
If non-null, these are the property-values the server will check as condition for this update.
Defines if this SetCustomProperties-operation gets forwarded to your WebHooks. Client must be in room.
member.returns: False if propertiesToSet is null or empty or have zero string keys. True in offline mode even if expectedProperties or webFlags are used. If not in a room, returns true if local player and expectedValues and webFlags are null. (Use this to cache properties to be sent when joining a room). Otherwise, returns if this operation could be sent to the server.

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.Player.SetPlayerNameProperty

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.Region.Cluster
member.summary: Unlike the CloudRegionCode, this may contain cluster information.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RegionHandler
member.summary: Provides methods to work with Photon's regions (Photon Cloud) and can be use to find the one with best ping.
member.remarks:
When a client uses a Name Server to fetch the list of available regions, the LoadBalancingClient will create a RegionHandler and provide it via the OnRegionListReceived callback, as soon as the list is available. No pings were sent for Best Region selection yet.
Your logic can decide to either connect to one of those regional servers, or it may use PingMinimumOfRegions to test which region provides the best ping. Alternatively the client may be set to connect to the Best Region (lowest ping), one or more regions get pinged. Not all regions will be pinged. As soon as the results are final, the client will connect to the best region, so you can check the ping results when connected to the Master Server.
It makes sense to make clients "sticky" to a region when one gets selected. This can be achieved by storing the SummaryToCache value, once pinging was done. When the client connects again, the previous SummaryToCache helps limiting the number of regions to ping. In best case, only the previously selected region gets re-pinged and if the current ping is not much worse, this one region is used again.

member.name: F:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RegionHandler.PingImplementation
member.summary: The implementation of PhotonPing to use for region pinging (Best Region detection).
member.remarks: Defaults to null, which means the Type is set automatically.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RegionHandler.EnabledRegions
member.summary: A list of region names for the Photon Cloud. Set by the result of OpGetRegions().
member.remarks: Implement ILoadBalancingCallbacks and register for the callbacks to get OnRegionListReceived(RegionHandler regionHandler). You can also put a "case OperationCode.GetRegions:" into your OnOperationResponse method to notice when the result is available.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RegionHandler.BestRegion
member.summary: When PingMinimumOfRegions was called and completed, the BestRegion is identified by best ping.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RegionHandler.SummaryToCache
member.summary: This value summarizes the results of pinging currently available regions (after PingMinimumOfRegions finished).
member.remarks: This value should be stored in the client by the game logic. When connecting again, use it as previous summary to speed up pinging regions and to make the best region sticky for the client.

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RegionPinger.GetPingImplementation
member.summary: Selects the best fitting ping implementation or uses the one set in RegionHandler.PingImplementation.
member.returns: PhotonPing instance to use.

member.summary: Starts the ping routine for the assigned region.
member.remarks: Pinging runs in a ThreadPool worker item or (if needed) in a Thread. WebGL runs pinging on the Main Thread as coroutine.
member.returns: Always true.

member.summary: This class represents a room a client joins/joined.
member.remarks:
Contains a list of current players, their properties and those of this room, too. A room instance has a number of "well known" properties like IsOpen, MaxPlayers which can be changed. Your own, custom properties can be set via SetCustomProperties() while being in the room.
Typically, this class should be extended by a game-specific implementation with logic and extra features.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.Room.IsOpen
member.summary: Defines if the room can be joined.
member.remarks:
This does not affect listing in a lobby but joining the room will fail if not open. If not open, the room is excluded from random matchmaking. Due to racing conditions, found matches might become closed while users are trying to join. Simply re-connect to master and find another. Use property "IsVisible" to not list the room.
As part of RoomInfo this can't be set. As part of a Room (which the player joined), the setter will update the server and all clients.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.Room.IsVisible
member.summary: Defines if the room is listed in its lobby.
member.remarks:
Rooms can be created invisible, or changed to invisible. To change if a room can be joined, use property: open.
As part of RoomInfo this can't be set. As part of a Room (which the player joined), the setter will update the server and all clients.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.Room.MaxPlayers

member.name: M:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.Room.SetMasterClient(Fusion.Photon.Realtime.Player)
member.summary: Asks the server to assign another player as Master Client of your current room.
member.remarks:
RaiseEvent has the option to send messages only to the Master Client of a room. SetMasterClient affects which client gets those messages.
This method calls an operation on the server to set a new Master Client, which takes a roundtrip. In case of success, this client and the others get the new Master Client from the server.
SetMasterClient tells the server which current Master Client should be replaced with the new one. It will fail, if anything switches the Master Client moments earlier. There is no callback for this error. All clients should get the new Master Client assigned by the server anyways.
See also: MasterClientId
member.param: The player to become the next Master Client.
member.returns: False when this operation couldn't be done currently. Requires a v4 Photon Server.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomInfo.PlayerCount
member.summary: Count of players currently in room. This property is overwritten by the Room class (used when you're in a Room).

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomInfo.MaxPlayers
member.summary: The limit of players for this room. This property is shown in lobby, too. If the room is full (players count == maxplayers), joining this room will fail.
member.remarks: As part of RoomInfo this can't be set. As part of a Room (which the player joined), the setter will update the server and all clients.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomInfo.IsOpen
member.summary: Defines if the room can be joined. This does not affect listing in a lobby but joining the room will fail if not open. If not open, the room is excluded from random matchmaking. Due to racing conditions, found matches might become closed even while you join them. Simply re-connect to master and find another. Use property "IsVisible" to not list the room.
member.remarks: As part of RoomInfo this can't be set. As part of a Room (which the player joined), the setter will update the server and all clients.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.RoomInfo.IsVisible
member.summary: Defines if the room is listed in its lobby. Rooms can be created invisible, or changed to invisible. To change if a room can be joined, use property: open.
member.remarks: As part of RoomInfo this can't be set. As part of a Room (which the player joined), the setter will update the server and all clients.

member.name: T:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.WebRpcResponse
member.summary: Reads an operation response of a WebRpc and provides convenient access to most common values.
member.remarks:
See LoadBalancingClient.OpWebRpc.
Create a WebRpcResponse to access common result values.
The operationResponse.OperationCode should be: OperationCode.WebRpc.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.WebRpcResponse.Name
member.summary: Name of the WebRpc that was called.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.WebRpcResponse.ResultCode
member.summary: ResultCode of the WebService that answered the WebRpc.
member.remarks:
0 is: "OK" for WebRPCs.
-1 is: No ResultCode by WebRpc service (check ).
Other ResultCode are defined by the individual WebRpc and service.

member.name: P:Fusion.Photon.Realtime.WebRpcResponse.Message
member.summary: Might be empty or null.
